docs.lead_paragraph: Central America is having one of its worst droughts in decades, and experts warned Thursday that major farm losses and the deaths of hundreds of cattle in the region could leave hundreds of thousands of families without food.

headline.main: Drought Hits Food Supplies in Central America
headline.print_headline: Drought Hits Food Supplies in Central America

docs.snippet: Central America is having one of its worst droughts in decades, and experts warned Thursday that major farm losses and the deaths of hundreds of cattle in the region could leave hundreds of thousands of families without food.

docs.lead_paragraph: Kim Min-koo has an easy reply to new American research that hits South Korea where it hurts — in the noodles. Drunk and hungry just after dawn, he rips the lid off a bowl of his beloved fast food, wobbling on his feet but still defiant over a report that links instant noodles to health hazards.

headline.main: Noodles: Friend or Foe? S. Koreans Defend Diet
headline.print_headline: Noodles: Friend or Foe? S. Koreans Defend Diet

docs.abstract: The medicalization of food deprives the dying of some of the last remnants of the human experience: taste, smell, touch and connection to loved ones.
docs.snippet: The medicalization of food deprives the dying of some of the last remnants of the human experience: taste, smell, touch and connection to loved ones.

docs.abstract: Researchers are questioning the assumptions behind morning meals.
docs.snippet: Researchers are questioning the assumptions behind morning meals.

docs.lead_paragraph: Three workers at a Louisiana grocery store pleaded guilty this week to participating in a $7 million scheme to exchange food assistance benefits for cigarettes and cash, federal prosecutors said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Louisiana Grocery Workers Plead Guilty in $7 Million Food Aid Fraud
headline.print_headline: Louisiana Grocery Workers Plead Guilty in $7 Million Food Aid Fraud

docs.snippet: Three workers at a Louisiana grocery store pleaded guilty this week to participating in a $7 million scheme to exchange food assistance benefits for cigarettes and cash, federal prosecutors said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Instant Noodles Tied to Heart Risk
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: It’s Time to Reel In the Ramen

docs.abstract: Women who ate instant noodles at least twice a week were 68 percent more likely to have metabolic syndrome.
docs.snippet: Women who ate instant noodles at least twice a week were 68 percent more likely to have metabolic syndrome.

docs.lead_paragraph: China has fined Japanese auto parts makers a record 1.235 billion yuan ($201 million) for manipulating prices as the government steps up its enforcement of an anti-trust law that has targeted major corporations and revived protectionism concerns.

headline.main: China Fines Japanese Auto Parts Makers Record $201 Million for Price-Fixing
headline.print_headline: China Fines Japanese Auto Parts Makers Record $201 Million for Price-Fixing

docs.snippet: China has fined Japanese auto parts makers a record 1.235 billion yuan ($201 million) for manipulating prices as the government steps up its enforcement of an anti-trust law that has targeted major corporations and revived protectionism concerns.

docs.abstract: Humans and dogs fuel exercise very differently. So if you’re taking your dog out for a run, take note.
